bio: I am a Software Engineer with expertise in backend development and cloud infrastructure.
Currently working at Rizzle and co-founding Timbr as Head of Technology.
I'm passionate about building scalable systems and optimizing performance.
I frequently write technical articles about AWS, databases, and modern web technologies.

description: Co-founded a full-stack agency with friends, leading the tech side to bring client ideas to life.
Built the backend for Bluestar Fleet Management, a platform that optimizes corporate employee transportation by tracking rides, pricing, and safety.
Designed the cloud infrastructure with CI/CD pipelines, making development smoother and faster.
Took the initiative in architecture and design, ensuring scalable and well-structured solutions.
Reduced video creation time from 7 to 1 minute by optimising code leveraging ffmpeg which improved customer retention.
Enabled analytics for customers on their product usage by implementing analytics API over MongoDB using nodejs.
Developed and indexed GeoJSON data in Elasticsearch, significantly improving location search query performance.
Automated deployment via a CI/CD pipeline for the machine learning team using AWS SageMaker, CodeBuild, and Jenkins.
Cut AWS costs by implementing S3 and ECR lifecycle policies and optimizing EC2 resources.
Improved scalability and fault tolerance by updating MongoDB cluster topology from 1 node to 3 node cluster.
Enabled disaster recovery by implementing daily automated backups of production databases and github repositories.
Improved system observability by instrumenting workloads with Prometheus and Grafana.
Automated video categorization for the marketing team using AWS Rekognition, Lambda, and Node.js.
Taught introductory C++ and assisted in teaching algorithms and data structures to 500+ students over multiple batches.
Built a real time code editor using firepad and ace editor api and firebase.
Created interviewer-interviewee matching algorithm to connect to online users for mock interviews using websockets.
Developed a video call application using opensource tools and added features for video and audio control.
Developed forum for Nados coding Bootcamp's social network to enable discussion among students.

interests: I enjoy writing technical articles about cloud infrastructure and backend technologies.
I'm passionate about optimizing systems for performance and scalability.
I like building tools that make developers' lives easier.
I'm interested in AI and machine learning applications in software development.

projects.name: Model AI
projects.description: Go-to platform that makes discovering, comparing, and implementing AI models effortless.
projects.longDescription: Model AI is a comprehensive platform designed to help users discover, compare, and implement AI models effortlessly. It provides real-time insights and clear comparisons, making it easier for users to find the right AI tools for their specific needs.

projects.name: Text PDF
projects.description: A seamless tool that lets users chat with their PDFsâ€”making document understanding faster and easier.
projects.longDescription: Text PDF is an interactive tool that allows users to have conversations with their PDF documents. It makes understanding and extracting information from documents faster, easier, and more interactive, improving the overall document management experience.

projects.name: GitHub Receipt
projects.description: A GitHub visualization tool that improves user analytics with an API-driven dashboard.
projects.longDescription: GitHub Receipt is a visualization tool designed to enhance GitHub user analytics through an API-driven dashboard. It helps users better understand their GitHub activity and contributions, and has been used by over 500 users to gain insights into their development patterns.

projects.name: Reunite
projects.description: Web application using AI to reconnect missing individuals with their families through image recognition.
projects.longDescription: Reunite is a web application built using Node.js, AWS Rekognition, and MongoDB that helps reconnect missing individuals with their families. It leverages AI-powered image recognition to match photos of missing persons with database records, making the reunification process faster and more accurate.

projects.name: Tinybite
projects.description: Web app that summarizes articles and generates relevant images for faster information consumption.
projects.longDescription: Tinybite is a web application designed to summarize articles and generate relevant images, making information consumption faster and more engaging. It uses advanced natural language processing techniques to extract key points from text and pairs them with visually appealing images.

projects.name: Pencil
projects.description: Web application that empowers users to sketch, create, and present their ideas visually with ease.
projects.longDescription: Pencil is an intuitive web application that enables users to sketch, create, and present their ideas visually. It provides a range of drawing tools and features that make digital sketching accessible and enjoyable for users of all skill levels.

publications.title: How to Create an AWS VPC
publications.description: Simplified the process of setting up AWS VPC, making cloud networking accessible for developers and engineers.

publications.title: Optimizing Database Performance: The Power of Indexing
publications.description: Explained indexing strategies to enhance query efficiency, reducing database response times significantly.

publications.title: Mastering Kubernetes: Understanding Resources and Limits
publications.description: Demystified Kubernetes resource allocation, helping engineers optimize deployments for scalability and efficiency.

publications.title: Setting Up Grafana and Prometheus on AWS EC2
publications.description: Provided a step-by-step guide to setting up monitoring and observability tools, enabling real-time insights into system performance.
